de.uka.ipd.sdq.beagle.core

Class Blackboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uka.ipd.sdq.beagle.core.Blackboard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Blackboard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Central and only storage of all knowledge gained by Beagle. Implements, together with BeagleController, the Blackboard pattern from POSA I. The Blackboard’s vocabulary consists of TODO: reference vocabulary types. It further allows classes to store custom data.

    The Blackboard is typically not accessed directly by its using classes, but through blackboard views (recognisable by having the BlackboardView suffix). These are surrogates for the blackboard. They don’t modify its contents but only restrict access to it.

    See Also:
    BeagleController, Serialized Form

      • writeFor

        public <WRITTEN_TYPE extends java.io.Serializable> void writeFor(java.lang.Class<? extends BlackboardStorer<WRITTEN_TYPE>> writer,
                                                                 WRITTEN_TYPE written)
        Writes data for writer to the blackboard. This method serves as a type safe mean for tools to store data that is not part of their results. Values stored here will never contribute to Beagle’s results. Any class calling this method should always pass its own Class instance as writer. writer has to implement BlackboardStorer and thereby declare the type of values they write. Calling this method will override any data potentially stored previously for the given writer.
        Type Parameters:
        WRITTEN_TYPE - written’s type.
        Parameters:
        writer - The class the data should be written for.
        written - The data to write.

      • readFor

        public <WRITTEN_TYPE extends java.io.Serializable> WRITTEN_TYPE readFor(java.lang.Class<? extends BlackboardStorer<WRITTEN_TYPE>> writer)
        Reads data previously written for writer through writeFor(Class, Serializable).
        Type Parameters:
        WRITTEN_TYPE - The type of the data to be read.
        Parameters:
        writer - The class the desired data was written for.
        Returns:
        The data written in the last call to writeFor(java.lang.Class<? extends de.uka.ipd.sdq.beagle.core.BlackboardStorer<WRITTEN_TYPE>>, WRITTEN_TYPE) for writer. null if no data has been written for writer yet.
        See Also:
        writeFor(Class, Serializable)
